name: 蔡佩芳
objective: In this course, the basic concepts and applications of Nonlinear Programming Models in Operations Research. It includes Integer Programming、Dynamic Programming、Game Theory、Markovian Chains、Queueing Theory、Inventory Theory、Project Management and Simulation Modeling﹒
schedule:
Week 1~3. Network Optimization Models, Project Management
Week 4~7. Integer Programming
Week 8~10. Dynamic Programming
Week 11~13. Game Theory
Week 14~15. Decision Analysis
Week 16~18. Markov Chain
scorePolicy:
Attendance:            10%
Quizes:	               40%
Mid-term Exams:    25%
Final Exam:	       25%.
materials: Hillier, F.S. and Lieberman, G.J. (2021), Introduction to Operations Research, 11th Edition, McGraw-Hill Int’l, Taipei. (required)
